questions.question: The main function of substations are

answers.a: To receive energy transmitted at high voltage from the generating stations
answers.b: To decrease the voltage to a value appropriate for local distribution

questions.question: Substations generally have
A circuit breaker is an automatically operated electrical switch designed to protect an electrical circuit from damage caused by ________.
The important characteristics of the fluid used in Circuit Breaker are :-

answers.a: It should have good thermal and chemical stability
answers.b: It should have high dielectric strength and are extinguishing ability
answers.c: Non- inflammability and high thermal conductivity

questions.question: The advantage of using oil in Oil Circuit Breaker as an arc quenching medium is:

answers.b: As a result of decomposition of oil, it has good cooling property
answers.c: Both it has high dielectric strength and as a result of decomposition of oil, it has good cooling property

questions.question: SF6 circuit breaker is ________

answers.b: SF6 gas has to be reconditioned after every operation of the breaker and additional equipment is required for these purposes
answers.c: Both expensive and SF6 gas has to be reconditioned after every operation of the breaker and additional equipment is required for these purposes

questions.question: Instrument Transformer are used because

answers.c: It is not practicable to connect instruments and meters directly to the lines in high voltage circuits
answers.d: Both It provides more safety and It is not practicable to connect instruments and meters directly to the lines in high voltage circuits

questions.question: A potential transformer is a

answers.c: Both step up transformer and step down transformer

questions.question: A current transformer is a

answers.c: Both step up transformer and step down transformer

questions.question: Big porcelain bushing, hollow insulators can be used up to _______ kV.
The use of ________ for high voltage applications is becoming more common.
The transformer works on principle of ___________
DC supply __________ be used for the transformer.
The ratio of secondary induced emf to primary induced emf is known as ___________
Current ratios are in _________ of the voltage ratio.
The transmission voltage in India are __________ .
Transmission network is commonly known as ____________
_________ is one of the best conductors due to its high electrical conductivity and high tensile strength for all type of transmission.
Aluminium has _______ the resistivity of copper.
When 1 or 2 percentage of cadmium is added to copper it __________ the tensile strength by ________ but ________ the conductivity by ________.
The advantage of using suspension type insulators over pin-type insulators is _________

answers.a: Cheaper in cost for operating voltage above 50kV
answers.b: Flexibility is increased with suspension insulators
answers.c: If line insulation needs to be increased, the additional insulators can be easily added to the string

In double bus bar system ,there is a provision of a bus-bar coupling switch for transferring operation from one bus-bar to another _________
Lighting arrestor are installed in

answers.c: Bus structures and steel superstructures in substation
